I feel that this game really makes the most of VR and has the same blood hungry feel of the Doom franchise while being less gorey and more interactive. This feels like the perfect game, but there are some things that I feel are "less than perfect." To get upgrades for your weapons you need stars and to get stars you need to play levels and complete certain goals, this, while being good in concept, is a boring and drawn out. To get all the stars it's not uncommon to have to complete the same level over and over again. In all I think this game isn't necessarily a "must have", but it's definitly something to check out if you have the money.

right this game is really cool and it makes you feel awesome when you grab ahold of a robot and tear it limb from limb. However, there is one thing that bothers me, and it REALLY bothers me: the movement. There is no smooth movement option. its ONLY teleporting and its so annoying, its so awkward and obtuse, literally every other VR game i have played has had smooth movement and either snap or smooth turning. not this game. this game has a movement system where you use the joystick to select the direction in which you wish to face BEFORE you teleport. (e.g. i point north and push the stick left to go north but face west) this system just irritates me to the point that i cant get into the groove, especially in the later levels when there are more enemies it just gets unnecessarily cumbersome to dodge stuff, heck you cant even jump. it gets on my nerves, big time. but if you dont get bothered by a terrible locomotion system then its totally worth a play.

review_title: Lots of fun. Death to robots.
one_reviews_text:
I've played through the main story now once. Working on unlocking all of my weapon options now. It has a good selection of weapons for the price and it can get very challenging if you want to shoot for high scores. The gunplay is solid and feels more refined than most of the VR games I've tried. Guns feel like they shoot where your pointing and controls feel pretty intuitive. 

My only complaint is the movement. You have to stop shooting with one hand and point at a spot while holding the stick to race a direction to move. This is very nice most of the time, but in the intense firefights it's a pain to move and dodge since you have to wait a second or two to confirm the movement. It's causes me to lose a lot of score when fighting in the most hectic fights.

Besides that one complaint, I truly think it's one of the best VR single shooters out there. Worth the $20.

This is a fairly short game, but omg it's slick! And the soundtrack is just mindblowingly awesome!

Edit: I see lots of negative comments about the locomotion system. I always found the thumbstick directional teleport much easier than snap/smooth turning, also faster and more comfortable. I tend to think of it as a teleport superpower. It IS a little dated though, and if you're used to smooth movement/turning it will take some time before it becomes second nature.

review_title: I solved this game on my old computer
one_reviews_text:
I enjoyed this game was disappointed when I got my new computer: 12700KF CPU, RTX 3080, and Windows 11.   Now it just crashes on load.

Update: I found the solution on Reddit.  It has something to do with OpenSSL and newer generation CPUs.
Follow these steps:

Go to System --> Advanced System Settings --> Environment Variables (You might get to this differently in different versions of Windows)

In THE SECOND window ("System Variables") click NEW

Enter name "OPENSSL_ia32cap"

Enter value "0x200000200000000"

Then click OK

You must REBOOT SYSTEM

This solved the crashing problem I was having with several Oculus VR apps and several Steam VR apps.

review_title: Fast-paced fun...for a while, that is
one_reviews_text: When I first got the game, I had a blast drilling throgh hoardes of robots and racking up my high score, and the bullet-catching feature was definitely amazing to experience first-hand. After the first few levels, however, the game got repetitive: enemies were no longer a challenge, and the weapons weren't as exciting to wield. Don't let this review scare you away if you're looking for a quick, fast-paced experience; this games delivers exactly that!

The fun this game gives comes in many forms. First is the witty comments from the AIs and the robots. Second is the amount of destruction you can do to a robot. Ripping off its arms and legs before ripping off its head... you can't help but giggle. But it does not end there! No, you can throw the bits at other robots! Grab a robot and use it as a shield. Punch them around, throw them for miles. For a bit more fun you can pluck a bullet or rocket out of the air and throw it back! 

And then theres the tricks you can do with guns. You don't just shoot them... you can use them as tennis rackets and slap the bullets back.  

But it gets better...

Grab a robot and throw it in the air, punch it as it comes down and send it flying into other robots!
Shoot a robot point blank in the head and catch its gun as it flies up in the air then shoot another robot thats about to attack you!

My friends and I are experimenting with trick shots and fancy kills at the moment.

Oh yeah, theres a story line that is actually fun but you will find yourself replaying levels because of the "I wonder if I can do this" thoughts so you can try another way of killing robots. 
Maybe you ripped a robots head off and threw it at another one... now your thinking "I wonder if that would have been as fun if I ripped its leg off and hit the other robot with it... can I hit a home run?"
and
"I need to try ad find out if I can toss a head into the air and hit it into the atmosphere like a baseball"

All in all a truely entertaining game.

Now, I'm going back into the game to see if I can pistol whip a robot...

Whether you're new to VR or a seasoned veteran; you can't go wrong with this title. Addicting gameplay loop and the detail in models/playspaces are insane. The gunplay? bar none one of the tightest and snappy feeling mechanics in a vr game. GET THIS GAME YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED.

review_title: Great gameplay, but very limited content
one_reviews_text: Playing on Quest 2.  Pretty decent game - fun challenges, great controls and gameplay.  The big problem - there are all of 9 levels in the main game, each of which can be completed in less than 10 minutes.  And even at that, they repeat in three sets, so there's essentially 3 levels with slight variations in setting and challenge level.  It's basically elimination, then defend the flag, then boss fight - repeat that 3 times, you're done.   It is an arcade-style game, but I was extremely surprised about how little content there is here.  All levels essentially look the same.  Visual quality is great, but the genereic 'futuristic city' backdrop in every level gets stale fast.  Even with replaying the levels multiple times to try to do better, I easly finished the game in about 3 hours.  Playing aggrestively straight through would have taken two hours at most.  There are only 4 weapons, again with minor mods and variations.  The combat does get creative with melee options.  Dialog is well-done and quite entertaining, and what little story is has is fun and well-written.  Kids will LOVE this game, but if you're looking for a title that will entertain an older user for an extended period of time, this is decidedly not it.  Once you've completed the challenges, there isn't much of anything to come back for.  Overall, it's fun, very comfortable, great visuals and solid controls - but really short, pretty repetitive and gets boring quickly.

We all (including every developer) know, that those cables will eventually break somewhere, once you turn and twist them one time too often, consequentually rendering the HMD useless. Cable repleacements for the most common headsets are a nightmare. 

Other than that, this experience is truly fun and well done. But playing with the knowlegde that I am probably ruining my headset during it sadly makes this not recommendable.

I love this game. From the very first level I played, it's been great. The graphics are excellent. The characters are all hilarious and memorable, with witty commentary coming from your AI companion as well the Robots which you "Recall" by killing them. The enemy robots themselves are actually quite intelligent, both in terms of actual AI and character. The controls are very fluent and intuitive, having you draw from the hips for pistols, or reach over the shoulder for shotguns. As well as this, you can grab enemies, remove limbs, shoot held enemies in the face, throw enemies into other enemies, and more. This is easily one of the best VR shooters I've ever played, due to the humor and highly interactive controls. Buy this game.

review_title: Fun core gameplay devoid of content
one_reviews_text:
Shooting guns and destroying robots has rarely felt and looked so good in VR - especially on PC, but for Quest standards, the graphics are still very good. Dual wielding shotguns, pistols, revolvers and energy rifles, dodging bullets in slow motion and grabbing rockets and sending them back to the enemy certainly makes you feel like a superhero. Unfortunately, there are two big problems with this game. 

The first one, where you can get used to, but still feels out-dated in nowadays VR worlds is the teleport only movement. You can only get around the levels by holding an analogue stick and pointing to the area you want to instant warp. You can also change your viewing direction while doing this by turning the analogue stick. 

The much bigger problem is the content. There are only three areas with three missions each. All of these missions take place in the same looking city. There are basically only rooftops, alleyways and streets. There are only four weapons to choose from and not much variation in the enemies. The third stage of each area is the same boss fight with little variation. It took me 2,5 hours to play through all of the levels and even in that short time the game became repetitive. I also had to do some replays because my Guardian crashed during gameplay and there is no way to manually adjust your heigh. So I was stuck a few centimetres above the ground and the game became unplayable. Overall this feels like the first act of a much bigger game, but unfortunately, it just ends. Sure, you can always play for high scores and hunt stars to unlock more weapons, but that's not everybody's cup of tea and we can expect more content from a 29,99€ game.

Such a good game, The combat is awesome, the way you can catch bullets and toss them back, the auto slow mo comes on at just the right time, and it makes you feel AWESOME!  There is a reletively good storyline to follow, and the characters are always talking to you, giving you compliments, and most importantly, telling you to "move agent 34".  When you finish the storyline and unlock all the weapons, it may feel like there is nothing left to do.  go back to the first level "Batch Recall" and make it a sandbox fighter.  the possibilities in this game are endless.

review_title: What are you waiting for? Buy it!
one_reviews_text: For most of us leaving reviews, it was a free game. If you are one of the unlucky people to not get it free, buy it anyway! IMHO, it is well worth the asking price. Yes, it's another wave shooter, but it is one of, if not THE best, wave shooter. There is a lot going on here. But, not so much that you won't know what to do. The robots are funny and highly destructable. Yes, it has teleporting movement, it works well in this game. You can grab the robots and pull them apart. Use them as a weapon. Catch bullets out of the air and throw them back. Deflect shots back to the robots, using your guns. Oh and you can just shoot them. You also have shotguns strapped to your back. If you are looking for a peaceful VR experience, this is not it. You really don't have to move around much, just teleport. The game looks great and I have yet to experience any game issues. C'mon, over 80% gave this 5 stars! Not many other games can claim that fact. This is a high quality game and I hope other devs look to this game for their inspiration. Thank you!
One of the best games in VR!

review_title: Robot Recall - immensely fun FPS game.
one_reviews_text:
Robot Recall is a fun and intuitive game that has the player "recalling" robots all over the city.

The player has multiple maps to choose from and while the game has you doing mostly the same thing all the time, I find myself enjoying myself for hours on end. The mechanics are great, and picking up guns from my back or belt feels amazing. You get a nice selection of guns, being pistols, shotguns, energy rifles and revolvers. You can attach various attachments to all the weapons and the game allows the player to manually attach the attachments which makes it feel really good. I don't think I've ever been so satisfied attaching things to a gun.

Personally, here is my opinion on the individual bits of the game:

Gameplay - 5/5
Story - 5/5 (although - there really isn't much)
Mechanics - 5/5
Feel - 5/5

The game itself is great and I have no FPS drops with a GTX 1060 6GB and i3 8100. The game is more comical than others and I also like that about it.

this is the first game I brought and I have to say this is such a shop I thought wave shooters were a thing of the past but this one is definitely a suprised.  So many ways to play this game but I think the replay value is a deal in itself

There are a few good VR games out there, I'm not convinced by the rest. But this game is the best VR game/experience I have had with the Oculus Rift so far. The interactions with the game environment are so natural that you learn pretty fast all the possible interactions. With this rich repertoire of interactions you have one of the best in-game immersion and feeling of freedom. This is what every VR game should aim for.

I also want to stress that locomotion via teleportation is a great choice, and I fully disagree with reviews that complain about it. To my opinion, the game would clearly not reach the satisfaction levels I get with the teleportation, for two reasons. First, like many people, regular in-game "walking" is often a source of motion sickness in VR games. With teleportation, I can play the game for hours without problem. Second, teleportation makes you feel very powerful, like omnipresent. You can pop up behind enemies, shoot them in the head, and jump from enemy to enemy at high speed since time slows down when you start teleporting. Maybe I was a bit disoriented at first, but it never really was an issue, since I don't remember it. Once you master teleportation, it feels very powerful.

The most polished VR title for a very long time when it came out. Leagues ahead of most of what was being released at the time, Epic really poured resources into making it look beatiful and play flawlessly. I usually prefer smooth locomotion, but the teleporation never bothered me in this game, it was executed very well (I think they were the first to give control over which way you will face after teleporting denoted by the arrow you can spin). The graphics are still next level on Rift with all of the particle effects. On Quest it loses some of it's beauty but keeps the fun and gameplay nearly identical.
I've heard there is some Iron Man mod for it to allow for flying around and blasting lasers, but can't find any YouTube footage or a way to install it.

Rift users: get that cord out of the way so you can spin around 360 for optimum gameplay.

Lots of replayability, levels aren't too long, good challenge for all VR newbies and pros. Keep 'em coming!

I really like this game! Its combat is super satisfying, and the dialogue/story has its moments. It does need a mode for when you just wanna kill some robots though. Be it open world, or just some maps which are not so objective heavy.

review_title: The best VR game I've played yet
one_reviews_text:
The reason I'm giving Robo Recall four stars instead of five is because it's really short; you can easily finish it in an evening (with a few breaks between missions).  That is the ONLY reason I'm not giving it five stars.  This is the best VR experience I've ever had.  And it is highly replayable; the game pretty much begs you to replay every mission until you max it out . . . which I guess makes it more of a 30-hour game. rather than a 3-hour game.

So, like many others, I bought a HMD for SUPERHOT VR.  This game absolutely crushes it.  Don't get me wrong; definitly buy SUPERHOT VR because it's incredible, but Robo Recall is just so empowering!  Grabbing enemies and slamming them against the ground, slamming them into each other, throwing them into the air, using them as "human" shields, using them as literal weapons (because, they have guns) . . .  the shear interactivity of the world is incredible!

And the guns.  Don't even get me started.  You can customize your loadout however you see fit, and you get upgrades for all your guns.  It does feel a bit lackluster; some folks have complained that there really aren't enough guns, and I totally agree.  However, if you're not happy with the guns, I'd like to point you to the free modkit you can download via UnrealEngine, where you can make your own guns.  Seriously, problem solved.

As PieroLeFou said in an earlier review, the teleportation mechanic is critical to how you play the game:  being able to teleport behind enemies — there is a cool-down to how often you can teleport — is an integral and tactical part of gameplay.  You need to utilize it.

On a side note, I found this game to be very intense, as in, I had to take breaks every two or three levels.  That's not a bad thing by any means, but I feel like you really need to be physically fit to enjoy the whole experience.  Maybe that's just me and my play-style, because I seriously got into it.  My thumbs started hurting after a while from rubbing on the controls
Great game! First game i purchased on my rift, absolutly no regrets.

That's what VR was meant for. Silly, funny, brutal, permissive... It's a lot of fun, but the experience is a little short and there are not enough levels and ennemies IMHO. You can replay a lot to unlock achievements and mods/weapons, and you can even mod the game, but I suggest to release more levels.
Overall, the campaign had me spend the 8 best hours I've ever spent with an HMD. The game is extremely polished and neat, and that's probably the best VR game out there for shooting things.

review_title: Great game but I wish there was more...
one_reviews_text: The game and mechanics overall were great. The campaign was just a little too short for comfort. Great overall idea though! I hope for some more levels and challenges to come forth via some new updates!
It's the gun game we all wanted whhen we were kids dreaaming about virtual reality ! 11/10 would buy again and recommend it to all vr fans

review_title: Still one of the best gun games on VR
one_reviews_text:
Been playing loads of VR games over christmas with my new Rift S and Robo Recall is by far the best gun game despite not being the newest.  Everyone should own this title!

It has great arcade style shooting gameplay, teleportation movement (more comfortable for non VR veterans), upgrades, and replayability to unlock all weapon super powers (which are amazing!).  Getting rid of "reloads" makes the gunplay feel so much smoother than a lot of titles and it just generally feels amazing to shoot stuff or grab robots and rip their heads off :)
cant even play because it crashes every time i load up a level

review_title: A VR must have. Just buy it!
one_reviews_text:
Robo Recall is absolutely fantastic. Look at how many people leave five star reviews on this game. That alone should tell you how well made this game is and how much people enjoy it. 

The concept and story are very well thought out, as well as the gameplay being marvelous. The teleport locomotion works extremely well for this game, so well in fact, that the game wouldn't be anywhere near as good without it IMO. The game also looks sharp and plays very smooth on my 1070.

It's a no-brainer: this game turns you into what is basically a demi god, whose objective is to teleport around shooting robots and ripping them apart. You can catch litteral bullets with your hands. Now that it is on sale there really is no reason not to buy it, or to hesitate.

Graphics and controls are perfect. 
You can unlock an extra hard mode if you do the normal levels at max score. :)

I honestly do not understand why the developers did not limit the use of teleportation. The game is way too easy since basically all you have to do is teleport and rip heads of robots. It's fun but quickly becomes work. Sure, you can play it any style you want but that won't land you into the leaderboard or anything. Not worth the money today as it is both short and shallow compared to newer games.
It's good AF. BUY IT
A great starter for someone who is new at VR.  The comfort settings don't inturupt the gameplay and add to the expierience!  Great game, one of favorites!
Great introduction to the VR world. Robo Recall.

I showed Robo Recall to my friend and he cound't stop playing it. If you want to experience drive and action, this game if a perfect choice. I really like it!

review_title: Makes you hope for a Zombie apocalypse..
one_reviews_text:
Zombies don't shoot at you, Zombies are usually not very fast, Zombies aren't very smart, Zombies were probably once nice people.  These are Robots with AI (very good AI - not that it takes that much, they're smarter than me) that  want to hurt you.  Correction... They want you dead.  

What really sets the game apart from many so other VR games is that you can play with friends and family (or even random humans).  So even if a family member is 3000 miles away, or more,  you can stilll have them right by your side helping you save the world from Robots that are. shall we say, angry and agressive... and oh yeah, they want to kill everbody.  
Might be good practice for when the singularity occurs but at that point it's probably too late.  Oh well.
Great game. Exceptional.  Play it while you still can.

review_title: One of the best VR Shooters out there!
one_reviews_text:
I got this game free from getting the bundle off the Oculus Store (website) and after a slight issue of it not being in my Library and needing some help from the awesome folks at Oculus, I got to enjoy it with my younger cousin and we KICKED BUTT! 

The guns are great! The enemies are great! And the story is...well...its basic but it works with the main baddie (and enemies in general) being HILARIOUS! The gameplay DOES get a bit repeative but every level is just satisfying to go through though the Challenges are annoying at times to get done. If you didn't get this game for free...just buy it and enjoy! Its a blast!

Everything about this game is fantastic, except the length. This is something I'd let friends play to show off how fun VR can be, but it would be a 'short' game at three times as long as it is; you can start-to-finish in less than two hours. Returning to each level to get all the 'stars' might work for you to increase the replay, but some of the requirements are so far beyond enjoyable that it would really be more frustrating than fun for me.
I got this free and thought it would be trash so didn’t play it for months. I was missing out! This game is awesome! Really immersive. I could play this for hours

review_title: It would be a 5 star if only...
one_reviews_text:
This is the first game I bought for VR and it literally blew my mind. 

In summary: it is  an arcadey and fun gun play (it does not pretend to be realistic) with a very simple plot (with some good humour). 

What I like: The slowmo makes you feel incredibly powerful, and you can enjoy killing robots in several ways (I personally lack of fantasy, but that's me). The graphics is polished and I like the feeling of teleporting around in a futuristic city (I wish one day a proper open world VR). This is a game easy to learn and difficult to master, where you need several play through to reach a scorethat is comparable with global rankings. There is the possibility of modding the game, although I haven't managed to make it work with mods, yet.

What I don't like: It is incredibly short. You'll finish the story in 1 hour or less!

An update with some additional content would fully justify the price tag.

So I own both an Oculus Rift and an Oculus Quest and have played this on both. It runs smoothly on both and I have loved both experiences. The rift is still my choice but I love both of my VR headsets. I have played this game so many times that I have lost count. I am really hoping for a sequel one of these days from Epic because this game is phenomenal. Oculus / Epic if you are reading this please make a Robo Recall 2!!!!!

I love every aspect of this game, visuals, gun play, sounds  etc but what I really cant stand is the lack of native locomotion support. Teleportation is my least favorite method of movement in games and the teleportation in this game is far more disorienting than any locomotion I've ever used. Yeah you can get a mod that adds support but it kills achievements and is also a subpar locomotion that would be great if the devs gave us proper locomotion support. This game is so freaking amazing using locomotion over the ugly teleportation system that almost always messes me up trying to remember where I'm facing when I do actually teleport. It just feels unnatural. I feel lack of locomotion is basically a deal breaker for how important it is to vr gameplay it breaks my heart to not want to pick this game up as much as I'd like to.
This game is SO FUN, but we need more content for this game to be worth the $30; There are only 9 missions. I like to think of it as $15 for the Rift version and $15 for the Quest version.
Seen what you have done with the Quest version, I think you could do better for the people with humble graphic cards. Thanks

Overall, this is a game that you definitely should have in your collection. If you're on the fence about buying it, go for it.

review_title: Why I bouhght the Rift and Rift S
one_reviews_text: What can I say, this is a great game. It has beautiful graphics and has a great story. the MOD support for this game is incredible and creates a replay value that will keep you coming back for more robot killing action. My only complaint is how short the campaign actually is. However if you take into account all of the goals you need to 100% this game it actually makes the campaign very long. Some of these goals can be very difficult and take some time and patience.

If you were going into Robo Recall with the train of thought of shooting robots and doing crazy enemy juggling and gun tricks from all angles, as the trailer showed, you'd be correct. Just requires that you don't have a handicap, as the seated teleporting controls are not the best. If you're standing however, and especially so if you have a 360-degree play space, it should work just fine.

Onto more issues.

The game fails to load half the time. It gives me the loading screen as I'm about to go into a level, and then it just keeps me there. I can look around, do whatever, but it still stays there. This might just be a problem with my specs, as my PC is a 'VR-ready' pre-built.

The story is just godawful. And I know this isn't a main draw for people, let's be honest. The trailer shows just that, and from the HUGE BELLOWING VOICE yelling out the title at the end, it just wraps it in a nice little bow. 
No, I much more mean the villain's motivations.
Do you really need a spoiler warning? Just don't read past this if you need to observe the story first-hand for some ungodly reason, you weirdo.

It's memes. Actually. For real. No hyperbole, it's memes.
Mind you, this isn't new memes like the dab thing or the Fortnites. Which, I can't tell is better or worse.
Doge, cat memes, all that 2008-2011 'memery' is pretty much the sole reason the villain is, well, the villain.
You know that part in the trailer where a robot says that he doesn't want to serve or something? Thought that'd be encorporated into the story, that staple of uprising conflicts?
Nah. Memes.

Whatever, I can get over it by just modding the voices out. I think. Don't quote me on that.

review_title: Was great on rift, no so much on rift s
one_reviews_text: I liked this game on the rift, but when i now play it on the new rift S it constantly puts me to the right of where i should be in game. Each time a level loads i have to reset view to be in the middle. Very annoying. Come on oculus this isn't the only game that needs updates for your new rift S.

review_title: This IS the best VR game around
one_reviews_text:
I have owned the rift for over a year and have bought and played many VR games. But it's strange how something so simple, and without multiplayer, is so darn good. From the music, to the graphics, to the motion, EVERY aspect of this game was well designed. I recieved it for free, but would have paid upwards of $50 for this. 

  Many people may disagree, but other games like Skyrim and Fallout are better outside VR. This is the best experience you can have in VR currently if you just want to mess around for a few hours. The replayability is insane! Unlocking weapons and their attachments feels like a welcome reward. The only negative thing I would have to say is that it does not have multiplayer capabilities. 

  If this game had a co-op mode, I would play nothing else for hours on end(with exception of VR breaks). Its simple on the story, but for what it lacks, the fluidity of the controls make up for it. The game possesses Matrix bullet time with the ability to catch and rethrow bullets!!! You can also rip robots apart and steal their weapons and kill them with it. The vortexs in-game are my favorite thing. You'll know when you get there.

  Bottom line: This is what VR is and should be. Most VR content is short and neat, but not worth your hard earned money. If you're new to VR and do not have this, YOU NEED IT! If you do not have this game at all and play VR, YOU NEED IT! Sometimes I feel like I could live in the game and be perfectly content....

One of the games I go back to again and again. Fantastic graphics and humor. So satisfying to smash the rogue robots to pieces. Very challenging. You won't beat this in one sitting as there's so much to uncover.

review_title: WARNING! Bugged with the Oculus Rift S
one_reviews_text:
Used to play this on my old Rift, its amazing.  Recently got the new Rift S and found out that unfortunately the game isn't updated for it, it shows the old touch controllers (not a big deal), but the big thing is it doesn't track your position in real life realitive to the game like it used to.  That may sound strange, let me give an example.

Ex:  If I'm shooting something, then take two steps to my right to say dodge a bullet or melee an enemy, the game still thinks I'm in the original position before the two steps but only for teleporting.  So now I'm two steps to the right of where I started, lets say I point my teleport to go straight infront of  an enemy, well I'll be two steps to the right of infront of that enemy.  Basically its not tracking my posistion in the game properly, it's playing as if I'm standing in one spot and never moving at all.

I've had this game since I bought my Rift a couple of years ago and it's still one of the top 5 games available.  This game is literally the reason I bought my Rift! I tested it out in Best Buy to see if VR was where I thought it should be, and ensure I could enjoy it.  I was sold immediately; I definitely recommend any new users to pick this one up. You won't regret it.

Only in it a couple hours, but wish it had been cheaper.  It is impressive as far as details and story.  However the gameplay is not as satisfying as I had hoped.  Just got done playing Superhot for 100 hours and loved every minute of it.  You just don't feel the connection to the weapons and the required destruction in this game.  Shooting in the game is not nearly as satifying as in the training room.  

The teleporting will require many hours to feel right, just not sure I love the game enough to put up with the hassle.
big much gudly
No WiFi required. Just robot killing spies killing spy killing robots! Lol
It is replayable but i like fresh new stuff but it is still one of the best games ever

This game is fantastic. Definitely my favourite VR gaming experience so far, but the game is very short. Taking the time to complete all stars for every mission is always fun. The robots comments and attitude are also very amusing. Perhaps adding some more missions or even an endless mode could increase the replayability and interest of this game. New weapon(s) would also be a great addition. throwable melee weapon like a sword, would be very cool.

Overall, this is a fantastic game, and would highly recommend!
I normally dislike most games but this one threw me for a loop. I honestly think this is one of my favorite games lol.

This game is honestly really fun and while there are not a bunch of levels, going back through and getting everything is great. I love the feeling of this game. It definitely reminds me of Super Hot. Would for sure recommend.

this game is amazing but it would be so much better with an endless mode where you keep playing until you die. it was fun with the levels but once you complete the levels all you can really do is replay the same levels over and over again. if you can add in an endless mode every experience would be unique in some way or another and it would add more replayability.

review_title: Must have to your VR Library
one_reviews_text:
This game is a significant advantage that other VR systems outside of Oculus simply don't have. This was the first VR game experience I had where had a "wow" moment and felt vindicated in my VR system purchase. The combination of its unmatched comforability, its astmosphere, and most importanly its INSANELY fun and addictive gameplay make it the gold standard of VR shooters. And it's not even close. 
The only downside to this game is really that I want more of it.
Anytime I have friends or family wanting to try out my Rift S, this is what I'm putting on for them.

review_title: AMAZING AND HOW IS THE FREE? However...
one_reviews_text: I can't explain how much I LOVE THIS GAME!! I have had so much fun with this single player shooter game. I had so much fun I completed the story mode in 2 days! The only thing that makes me sad is the there is no type of endless mode. I would be playing the game for hours on end if this game had some type of endless mode. Other than that, HIGHLY RECOMEND TO VR STARTERS!!!!!!

the main issue i have with this game is how you rotate, i hate how you have to push and rotate the same thumbstick at the same time. Maybe have teleportaion on the left and rotation on the right. Still, its a very well-made game for VR
Great Graphics. Great Experience. The Classic.

review_title: Not my cup of tea, but amazing
one_reviews_text: Ok so This is not my style of game at all. Im very picky about battle games and very very rarely do I like them. I love the dynamic fighting style, The easy to follow combat instructions and honestly, Everyone I know loves to come over and play Robo Recall. So Even though I dislike any game like this, THIS GAME IS AMAZING
Visually wonderful, great gameplay, everything in this game is good.

From the first time I put this on at a friend's house, I was hooked. I didn't own a VR headset at the time, but in under a week, I made it happen. I immedietly bought Robo Recall and was met with unending satisfaction. I can't express how incredibly fun this game is when you dedicate an hour or so to playing a couple of levels. I could personally play it for all eternity if noone ever pull the headset of my face. I absolutely love it!

This is definitely one the best VR games I've played thus far and I've owned the top three VR headsets at some point. The game is so much fun just to shoot Target Practice in your office sometimes. It's an absolute must buy!

Truly the best VR shooter, rich in gameplay, physics, and even has a simple comedic story to keep things rolling. And with mod support, this game can provide endless hours of thrilling combat, both ranged and melee. roborecallmods.com

The production of the game seems quite good, the story seemed passable and the visuals were nice. However, my entire experience was a matter of standing there being dumbfounded by the choice to force teleportation and snap turning upon the player. There are mods that can be applied, but apparently not to the main game. If this ever changes, I'll give the game another try.

Only bought it cause I know people who never tried VR and I know they'd enjoy a good FPS.

Myself, I don't really care for teleport-only games.
this game is great, its fast paced and has a lot of diferent combat options. it looks great and is very fun

This game is one that is a must for any VR gamer.
The only problem is it is a pretty small game, and is over before you know it, but when you do play, it is amazing. I beat it once, and after a while I came back and beat it again.
There are mods that can expand the game, but mods shouldn't be required to give a game enough content to play with.
However, the actual gameplay and content the game does have is quite spectacular, but this game just needs more levels, an endless mode, or could even be fleshed out into a bigger open world type game.
Everything that a VR game should be.

It's absolutely 100% worth it. Makes me feel like an awesome action hero. But just as you unlock almost all the upgrades for your weapon, the game suddenly ends, and you have to go back to previous missions to complete challenges such as "get 2 000 000 points". I wish it was a lot longer than this.
I guess I see it as all arcade.It would be cool to have a detective type blade runner mission.Jesusavesouls !

its the most fun i ever had i have played a lot of vr games that were good but this one is free and has good gameplay the story isnt really good i think but the hole game is something you wont see anywhere else five stars from me :) good work

You move by projecting yourself away, but that's fine by me.  This is a nice, active balance to my Lone Echo, which is equally fun, but entirely different.

one_reviews_text: The game is great, i had this on the first rift and i am playing it on my new rift S BUT a note for DEVS please and to other devs please update these games so when we see ingame versions of our controllers they need to looks like the new rift S controllers and not the old touch controllers as i find it way too jolting
This is a great game for vr. It has amazing graphics and has very fun combat. I would recommend it to any newcomer to VR.

I finally bought this only seen it only sale once I would buy it again if it were $20.00 just thought at 30.00 to much the grahics, fun, and humore is great.  Lastly  i dont understand why they didnt assign a jet pack or something for people that can handle free movments.  Only gave it three stars because of the price and lack of depth

The best shooter experience so far in VR. The fast, frenzied and epic experience that is RoboRecall truly shines when, for the first time, you teleport behind a robot, grab its body, use it as a shield against a point blank shotgun shot, rip off the robot’s head and sling its body halfway across the map before reaching both hands behind your shoulders and pulling out twin shotguns only to unload every round into the robot in front of you. 

Every time I play this game, my cable (suspended by the ceiling) is twisted up a million and one times from spinning around the room with twin pistols and shotguns blasting baddies as if I’m John Wick meets Neo. The absolute power trip this game gives you is unreal. 

While the game is a bit short on content, you’re incentivized to replay missions after receiving weapon upgrades to achieve more stars and higher scores. This kind of replayability is something I almost never do in video games, but RoboRecall is so much fun that I will gladly continue replaying missions.

This is one of the most fun experiences you'll ever have in VR. The fact that they made dead and buried 2 without making any DLC or a sequel to this game is a travesty of the highest order.... What are they thinking over there?!?!?!
Guaranteed best seller even using the same engine with more weapons, maps, missions and enemies!!! Step it up guys!!! We're thirsty out here!!!

Great game all around. Graphics, tracking, and immersion. There’s a lack of story here but I believe it’s on purpose to keep the game fast pace and arcade-like. The combat system has so much detail, you have so many options at your disposal. Your gun ran out of ammo? Toss it at a robot’s face. Bullets coming right at you? Catch them and throw them back. About to take a punch? Grab the robot and rip its arm off. Very awesome game, highly recommend it.
I would give this 5 stars if you would put free movement as an option

This is a very funny VR action game. I love the mechanics of the game and the freedom they give you. You can use a variety of guns with upgrades, but you can also use your hands to grab and pull apart the robots. Just a great use of the touch controllers and it's super immersive without taking itself to seriously.
This game is so great and plays so smoothly, the only thing keeping from being 5/5 stars is just that it’s a little short I hope in the future we get an update. Fingers crossed

I haven't finished it yet but I love this game. The music, the combat, the sassy AI, the atmosphere. It's tons of fun and the game utilizes VR amazingly. I had some issues with lag on a few occasions but it may have been my hardware that caused it. The issue was more or less taken care of when I reduced some of the graphical settings. The game still looked amazing and I didn't notice any difference. You can repeat a mission as many times as you would like, in order to achieve the stated goals at the beginning of the mission. The fact that the combat was fun, makes me want to keep playing even more.

The only thing I would add, is the ability to rotate without having to teleport. And perhaps more of a variety when it comes to weapons and environments. However, the game is still solid and I would definitely recomend. It's well worth the money. I would play it for longer periods of time, but the game serves as a great workout as well. I'm dreading the muscle pains I'll have tomorrow morning. I've only had my headset for a few weeks, but this is the best VR game I've played so far. GET IT!

i recently got my rift s for father’s day...i have only played a few games...this has been the most fun so far

This title takes me back to the golden age of gaming, playing Duck Hunt on NES with the Light Zapper, or World Class Track Meet with the PowerPad. It's just pure *fun*. Every part of this game feels great. The shooting, the melee attacks(!). Doding bullets like Neo in The Matrix. Grabbing bullets and rockets mid-flight and throwing them *back*. I can't stop smiling. Love it!

review_title: The most polished, powerful & fun in VR

Graphics quality, overall polish, fun, powerful feeling, difficulty scaling, replay value, simple to get started, with plenty of depth to discover.  A go to when introducing anyone to VR.  I would buy this game without hesitation and any DLC released.

review_title: Possibly my favourite game of all time
one_reviews_text: As the title says I believe this game to be incredible. It's like the arcade games of old where there is one goal in mind, shoot everything on the screen and Robo Recall is exactly that. You have guns, infinite reloads and the simple objective of shooting robots and who doesn't love that?

This is a well-known impressive 1st VR experience and a great game to demo to people new to VR.  Overall it is just a very polished, very fun, and very immersive VR game.  However, apart from replaying the same missions over and over to try to get higher scores, it doesn't have much content.  It does support modding, but unfortunately because it came out in the early days of VR, modders just weren't interested so there is very little out there and nothing that adds significant content.  Shame that Epic didn't ever add more content or sell some DLC.  Most people will get this free anyway so I can't say it isn't "worth" it.  It is a fantastic but  woefully short experience.  Here's hoping Robo Recall 2 gets made one day and that it is a full game.

This is the best VR game I've played, hands down.
The only problem is that it's rather short, even if you do all the challenges and get 100% completion, it's relatively short.  This game was free with Oculus Touch and absolutely needs an expansion. I'd buy one for $50 that adds 6 new maps and missions, maybe a few guns and a few new enemies. Nothing else has to change, just add more content! Take my money!

I've been playing games since I had Pong as a kid in the 70's. Robo Recall is one of the most immersive and interactive experiences I've ever played. There's so much you can do and so many ways to do it. The gunplay is extremely well done, allowing you to pull off every insane action-movie stunt ever.

I had three robots coming at me, two crawlers behind them. Took one shotgun from over my shoulder and took one's head off. I Immediately swung the shotgun and deflected about five bullets before throwing it and grabbing another bot and ripping it's head from it's torso. Threw the head at one crawler and blew it up. Used the torso as a shield as the next crawler jumped at me. Used the torso to smash the crawler at my feet. Last bot I just grabbed both pistols from my belt and unloaded until he collapsed. 

That whole scenario unfolded in a matter of seconds, and it was as natural and real as anything I've ever experienced in any arcade or theme park attraction. This is what people would wait in line for hours to experience for just 3 minutes. Robo Recall is an exceptional game that shouldn't be missed by anyone who has a Rift and Touch controllers - truly what VR was made for.
The game is great but I have a problem installing the game, it does not complete the installation and it gives an error.

review_title: My favorite Rift game so far
one_reviews_text:
I recently got into VR gaming and I have to say this game is my favorite. Once I got the hang of it all other shooters fell short of the level of entertainment I get from this game. My only complaint is that it is shorter than I’d like. Now that I have all my guns maxed out there is no where to go. Is there another version coming? I’d buy them in a heartbeat

It is also very hard to get 5 stars on a mission, even hard to get more than 1 on some missions. But overall, I think it is a great game from Epic Games.
I like the game alot. It is very fun and I love to play it whenever I get on the VR.
This is a great game, and it is free!! Better than some of the other paid VR games you can get. I HIGHLY recomend this game, I would have been happy if I had paid for this game.

The game is great fun, with a fair number of missions that shouldn't take more than ten or so minutes each.  There is a wide variety of enemies with good interaction between themselves and the player.

It's beautiful and polished and has a sense of humour.

The base missions are good, but to collect all the stars requires a lot of skill.
very funny cool graphics lot of action not enough guns but few amelioration and so many ways to "kill" robot :P a must !
how do you get the explosive shotgun

review_title: My Go To Game (and No Blood!)
one_reviews_text:
From the first time I ran it, this has been my favorite VR game.  I like to use various mods to vary up the gameplay.  Regardless that I've played every mission multiple times I still enjoy this game even if its just for one round to finish off the night.  I do wish there were more levels or DLC's from the creators.  Everything about this game is so well done I will always be hungry for more.

I would like to make one point that brings me back to this game for FPS fun: I'm killing robots and there isn't any blood.  Its not that I'm squeamish but rather I am an Iraq combat veteran with PTSD.  When I play FPS where I shoot humans or even zombies, particularly when there is a big splash of blood when an enemy is hit, it tugs on memories that make me mentally and physically very "uncomfortable."  This may be a small or inconsequential thing to most people but for me it means the difference between a playable and non-playable game.  So my hats off to the creators for making a bloodless game.

review_title: Great game to come with a bundle
one_reviews_text: I'm so glad i got this with the bundle. It is amazing
amazing

I LOVE this game! Got it for free with the Oculus Touch, and lemme say I still enjoy it! I would gladly have paid for it. I wish though that the developer would add some more levels, or other cityscapes, or SOMETHING! Yes, I've not solved it on hard mode yet, but I am learning more about all the different ways you can kill robots... Throwing the guns at them is fun, as is beating them up with their own arms. The graphics are AMAZING, try teleporting on top of a car, ledge or what not and you really feel like you're above the action. And yes, I get into it highly, by ducking, moving sideways to avoid bullets, and even crouching down to make myself a smaller target, and it all works! Gun shooting is fluid and stable, and enemies will pop up behind you at times... THIS is one of the best reasons to own a VR with touch controllers...

review_title: A VR modder's haven (once you learn it)
one_reviews_text:
I absolutely love this game to bits. It's one of the simplest games to mod that I've ever seen (and that's on top of the fantastic story mode in and of itself)

The one problem with it being a modder's paradise is that there's not a lot of handholding. Luckily mostly all the game is viewable from it's mod editor (gotten from the Epic Game's launcher, not Home) so if you REALLY want to, you can dig into their files and pretty much figure out how everything works, but there are few guides available to help newcomers to Unreal Engine get started modding this game. I've made a couple myself (look for RavenX185 on Instructables if you're interested) to help people get started though, because I absolutely love making mods for this game. Once you figure out how the various systems work, it's very easy to plop new models in place of the basic weapons and create your own awesome gameplay on new maps! Just takes a bit of learning. Overall, this game is solid in every way, and I can't wait to see the modding community grow. It has amazing potential, just takes a bit to get started.

review_title: I still can't believe this is free!
one_reviews_text: Possibly the most fun I've had in years - no lie!  Everything about this just screams 'win'!  I absolutely love the aesthetics, the robot and world designs are fab, the music is really dynamic, and the action, controls and immersiveness are just top-notch. It's also really funny, and tons of fun to play! Kudos to the developers!

Epic games you have made a VR masterpiece.

Alright. So i've been playing Robo Recall and i noticed a bit of a problem that annoys me. 


I have to go to the missions to even play the game, in my opinion this game would be alot more fun if we had Open World. The reason why i want this is because we always have to go back to the missions to play the game.

Anyways, if open world comes out, you could make it like every so often an event happens like protect this or kill those robots over there and bring em up into the gigantic blimp above us, you could add events that are based on the things you have to do in Story Mode.

You could turn this into an MMO with people that you can see in Open World, maybe even add customization so you can look fancy and stuff.

We also need some more weapons, theres not alot of weapons in this game, you could add a minigun that goes on your back and requires 2 hands, you could add laser whips that stick to your pockets (i would love that), or you could add melee weapons.

If you agree with me, thumbs up.

This is a very fun game. The kids can play, too, since theres no blood. And my favorite part, is that you can get the Epic Games launcher, and get a mod kit! The SDK package is really fun to mess around with. I highly recommend this game!! Edit: I would enjoy a co-op PVE (maybe with a seperate campaign) and it would be awesome if there was a version for the Vive, (Maybe make them pay for it, since Oculus users had to get the Touch) to cross-play with Oclulus players. Keep making this game awesome!!

one_reviews_text: The title tells it all. The mechanics of this game are so fun to play and work so well in VR that it is a freaking blast. Shooting feels great, reloading feels great and everything is just so fun. I'd pay for additional content to expand the campaign because it is a joy. I'd love to see a wave mode or something that would be good for handing off the controller from friend to friend. Either way i'd love to see more of this!

No doubt this is a game thay sells systems. Graphics are amazing and it plays flawless. If there was a demo at every walmart this would open the eyes of vr to the world.  In fact this was the game I demoed at a best buy store that made me buy a rift. This non stop shooter will leave you with smiles and begging for more this where the let down begins. This game truely needs multi player much like Lone Echo that will keep you coming back for weeks and months. I just dont understand how such a hit game can be left die. No words even on a sequel.

The story is pretty alright towards the end but the gameplay is the best part. The placement of the weapons are good and i really liked the weapon upgrade system. I even liked the little touch that you could actually equip them yourself. The game has very little replayability though. When i finished it, i couldn't bring myself to play it again.

It's also the game I always put on for someone who comes over and wants to try out VR. Really fun and rated PG (no blood/gore). It is interesting how well this is aging.

review_title: Super Fun, Super Polished, Super SHORT
one_reviews_text: This game is one of the most polished games out there for Oculus. It's fun and you feel like a bad a** playing it. Problem is that it's WAY too short. Not anywhere near enough content. I wish there were more to it. I beat it so quickly. Luckily it was free so I'm guessing there's going to be more similar games from Epic soon?

When I first picked up a Rift this was the first thing I played. And JESUS CHRIST this game shows off the innovation Oculus is bringing. The controls are like butter, gunplay is fantastic, and graphics are beautiful. That said, I need to complain a bit. Keep in mind this is a free game and a kind of demo. The one big problem I have with the game is how shallow it is. 4 weapons, limited attachments, 9 levels. The game starts to feel repetitive at times, but still is entertaining and fun to rack up high scores on a leaderboard.
Worth your time.

This was one of the first games I played when I bought my Rift, and it is still my favorite! I'll duck behind cars and shoot at the hordes of killer robots. It's a lot of fun plucking bullets out of the air and throwing them at robots, using robots as shields, or just blasting them to pieces with shotguns. 

I LOVE that there is a storyline, and the game play gets progressively harder as you go.

Leave it to Epic Games to develop the benchmark shooter for all of VR. This game has limitiations intermso of game modes, content, and guns. That is all the bad i have to say about this game. The shooting mechanics, bullet physics, and satisfaction from an accurate shot is off the charts. The sounds of the weapons are thebest of any shooter so far on VR. I can't recommend this game evough to any Oculus Rift owner. You can't go wrong with this game.

awesome game ... 
the graphic is great and and belongs to one of the best in actuell VR games.
the soundtrack is amazing!
the gunplay is flawless and feels realistic.
really great VR experience

It is nuts to play a game with this many crazy interactions. Pulling off limbs. Throwing enemies, their ammo, or your own guns at them. Doing some Matrix moves to dodge. It's kind of like an impressive VR tech demo.

I am always skeptic on games that come with a console free, but I have to say this game is amazing. It is among one of my favourites. It has fast game play, presentation is great, great sound, and Arcady(if you like that type of gameplay. Back to gameplay, the amount of things you can do is incredible;
1. Grabbing bad guys and tearing limbs and heads
2. Able to catch bullets mid-air and throw them back
3. Using enemies as meat(in this case robot) shields
4. Throwing enemies in the air and playing keep up
5. And more(list can keep going)

although it is a little bit old, this title is, from a techincal point of view, the example of how a game in VR can amaze for its graphics, through the right use of the hardware resources made available. Some aspects of gaming mechanics are perhaps dated. The only type of locomotion is teleportation. In addition, the game is too short and i have the feeling that this is almost a demo for a potential AAA game rather than a complete title. Perhaps at the end, as well as a technical standard, this game is also an example for what VR is right now: sadly there are still no profit margins to ensure that developers works full-time for years to a game exclusively dedicated to the VR market.

It came for free with the oculus bundle, and boy it has triple A quality.
I can only recommend.

I wish there was some Open World mode or Community Made Levels or Weekly Challenges or something for people to do once they've finished the game. The levels are pretty easy to jump back into and play again but it'd get boring to keep playing the same level over and over.
Epic Games, please please please release more content for this!
the part were it works without internet is not true. but ofer all the game is great.

However, the level of perfection is high, so this level of discomfort is okay

I have to admit, I wasn't truly sold on the trailers etc, but man, when I started playing and got used to the mechanics, I was insanely hooked, it's a crazy good game with crazy nice graphics also.  I found it fluid and the gunplay is ultra slick, it was just a great experience.

If this game had multiplayer, it would be top of it's class!  But man, the SWEAT!!  I found myself shattered with some of the intensity and it was really satisfying, I recommend that you put a sweat band or something between your face and the foam on the headset around your eyes, so it won't get soaked. :3  I would dare say this could function as awesome cardio.

I will add that, I understand the movement mechanics being really good for getting behind opponents, however, if it had an open movement system, it would potentially be more awesome, I ain't sure though since I ain't sure how it would affect enemy mechanics.  Outside of that, so so good!
Great game.  Lots of fun!

Bonus star for the excellent use of UE4. The background and graphics are amazing. But it's in the service of a very tired trope of a VR game.

review_title: Needs to be pack-in game for roomscale!
one_reviews_text:
This needs to be a branded boxwrap on a full 3-sensor roomscale kit. This is the perfect roomscale game to introduce longtime PC gamers to virtual reality gaming. 

Whether you're an FPS fan normally not interested in virtual reality -- or get very sick on rollercoasters -- TRY this game.  This game is optimized to be very comfortable in roomscale VR.  

For the biggest thrill -- strongly recommend you have 3 sensors and run in roomscale mode. This ONE game is worth the CAD$100 for a 3rd sensor!! 

My roomscale is a very tight 5x7 foot in the middle of a cluttered room, and I never once accidentally hit anything outside my roomscale. There's a VR marker below you so you know your calculated flailing, dodges and all, doesn't hit physical objects. To VR newbies, that "Star Trek Holodeck" grid automatically appears when I get too close to my desk or bookshelves lining my room, so you're safe and quickly step back to the holographic centre marker representing the center of your physical room, safely away from all the clutter. While I recommend a bigger roomscale space for the optional (but MUST-PLAY!) roomscale mode for this game, it's certainly very playable in a 5x7 and it still felt very open-world, with those skyscrapers towering realistically above me.,

Also... If you run it in roomscale mode in higher difficulties, it becomes bonus intense exercise as you actually DODGE many incoming bullets (from the robots) by moving side to side.  Frantically trying to shoot two approaching robots at the same time with two guns -- one aimed independently in each hand!  Aiming separately with two guns in separate directions!  Imagine doing FPS with two computer mice with two crosshairs.  That is FPS to a new "dimension" (Pun intended! Get it!).  And I never once felt nauseous.  

This VR game is well done, yet exciting, that even the motion-sick can dare to give it a try -- even you "VR ride haters" that tried VR FPS once (e.g. Half Life 2 VR version) -- give this game a try.

This game is one of my favourite games in vr and so well put together making anything a wepon and just destroying robots is fun and with lots of levels and over a couple hours of gameplay its a great purchase (not that i has to pay anthing with it being free) but also the free price tag makes it more favorable to the vr newbies who want the best vr can offer and this is it.

The actual gameplay is mainly including beating up waves of robots and different kinds : Melee bots, pistol bots , shotgun bots, wierd rocket bots, large TANK like bots you can get behind and use its laser to destroy! and there are others but reading a list is much more boring than actual playing.

The array of wepons you can use is great! Use duel pistols or a shotgun (even rifles) and all the guns have attachments you unlock at certain points. You can also use robot parts such as their own arms or heads to beat them or other robots up! Most of all is the bullets, the matrix comes to vr! Whn a robot shoots at you everything slows down and your able to move yourself to dodge the bullets and even grab one midair and throw it back.. i know sounds crazy but the mechanic works so well.

In the end just give it a try with it being free whats to hate if you don't like it and if you do ; Enjoy.

review_title: Probably the most entertaining VR FPS
one_reviews_text: Can't believe how much I keep returning to this game. The only things I miss are multiplayer and the ability to turn in place (Oculus Home kind of movement).
Love It! Please give us more freedom in this awsome city!

This was the best game I have experience on Oculus so far. If I ever show the oculus to friends, this is the game I'll launch. You'll get a hang of the basic controlls rather quick and the action is so immersive it impresses everybody, especially the jump scare in the intro gets everybody pumped up. Having all the robots up in your face really makes the game feel immersive.

There are not many levels, but it doesn't really get boring to redo them and gather more points, cooler kills, and weapon upgrades. The levels and story is also engaging and even though the game restricts the area for each level you rarely experience this restriction and it feels quite open.

The weapons are amazing and very responsive. Grabbing the shotgun from your back was a great touch, although I felt the shotgun was not as amazing as it could have been (or maybe I'm just a bad shot). 

Teleporting in order to move around gets rid of the uncomfort when moving, and it is a great extra in the game. Once you get a hang of the teleportation you can move around very quick while killing robots and avoid getting hit.
If it does not start, try to disable Kaspersky or allow audio access

review_title: Best game in VR I've played
one_reviews_text:
At it's core it's an arcade shooter. The story is just enough to give you some context to the swarms of robots you will be 'reclaiming'. The progression mechanics are just enough to keep me playing to earn all the acheivements to unlock more attachements for the guns. 
The star of the show however are the controlls. I feel like this is going to be looked back on in the same way we look at the original Doom. Sure there are other shooters in VR with similar controll setups but this feels like the way forward.

The games only real weekeness is a lack of content. The limited variety in robots and locations can get a little stale. The soundtrack is excelent and well suited but very short. You are going to be over the few tracks ingame within the hour and you'll be wishing there was an ingame spotify player.

All in all, this is the kind of game that VR has been waiting for. Something dedicated to the platform that doesn't just feel like a neat tech demo or an 'experience' to show off the hardware. This is the Super Mario Galaxy to the Wii's Wii Sports
Probably the best gun play you can have in VR! So many way to kill enemies. I just wish there was some kind of wave mode or something to replace the missions once you've completed the story.

review_title: Wish I could give it 10 stars!
one_reviews_text: So I started out messing around in the office a while, getting used to the movements and shooting some targets. Once I was comfortable with the controls I started out on a 'recall' (destroy mission) and shot a few times and thought that was cool. It got progressively more intense and I was so focused on shooting that I stopped moving. A robot was attacking me from behind, so I turned around and GRABBED IT and use it as a melee weapon until I could push them back far enough to use my guns again. Completely immersive, I felt like I was there. Incredible game! When I got back to the office after the mission I was so wound up and full of adrenaline that I grabbed the dummy robot and started beating the daylights out of it until I cooled down some. This game is what VR should be.

Its my first VR game after getting use to the controls I jumped right in, next thing I know I was dual wielding pistols popping robots in the head. I used one as a human shield shooting over its shoulder to take its buddies out, before tossing the body into another robot. Teleporting over to punch it in the face, take its gun and shoot another that was trying to get me from behind. 10/10 its like a futuristic John Woo movie with you in the staring role

I'm only writing this after two missions, but this has got to be, without a doubt, one of the best VR experiences on the market currently. My machine is a little low-end, I get the "Your computer doesn't meet Rift's minimum specs" message all the time in the menu and store. This game runs flawlessly, with high-end graphic options on even this budget PC.

It FEELS good to play, reaching over your shoulder for a back-mounted shotgun one minute, reaching down to your side holster for a pistol the next. Throwing said spent pistol at an incomming robot, to then have the gun richochette off the robot, back into your reach fully reloaded is just.. beautiful. And not to mention you can LITTERALLY RIP ROBOTS INTO PIECES BY HAND.

Lets not forget this game is FREE if you buy Oculus Touch. I would hae paid for this seperately if I had to, but this being free is simply insane value for what you're getting.
